column4: whats the easyest way to connect to the ubuntu "terminal" from windows?
easyest way to connect to ubuntu from windows? telnet?
plz? how do you connect to an ubuntu comp from a windows comp?
from dos prompt in windows: telnet ubuntu_I.P>
no, just the IP of the ubunto workstation
doesn't work.. do i have to activate something?
does the ubuntu workstation have the telnet server running and is remote login set to allow?
no, how do i activate it?
lemme see (I'm not an ubuntu specialist)
system / administration / services (and see if telnet server is running)

I would say you might have to add the telnet deamon then... I would not be able to tell you how to do this. I just started evaluation ubuntu (which is debian based).. my main experience is with redhat which is rpm based when it comes to installing additional components.
at least you have an idea what to look for
how can i connect to an ubuntu using telnet?
maybe you could snoop around in the add applications panel? (just an idea)
